184861528.review:
I am extremely biased about this game because I grew up with it on the Xbox 360 as a little kid, and spent a lot of time with my old online friends just playing Hall of Heroes PVP with our modded weapons screaming gleefully at each other. However, I also think that gives me the perfect perspective to give a recommendation because I'm a lot older now and somehow still get the same enjoyment out of playing this game for hours on end trying to get a new high score on a map, or finding the perfect choke points to help me get a win I otherwise couldn't have gotten. I am not a tower defense kind of guy, I usually stick to single player games with rich stories but even this game has a lot of detail, especially in the maps. The atmosphere changes with each map, and the coziness of the Tavern is the cherry on top. The graphics aren't crazy but as long as I can see the love and soul while playing, that's okay with me. You will find references and even pictures of the Devs all over the game, which is not something you usually see. The love this game was made with is evident in every hour you spend playing.

This game does excel at being a co-op title, but you can still play through and enjoy the hell out of the entirety of this game by yourself. The game allows you to create as many characters as you want, basically letting you have every hero maxed out if you wanted to, even duplicate heroes with different stats allowing for a different play style. This means that you can use any combination of traps and defense on any map allowing infinite replay ability. The maps in this game? There's a few boring ones don't get me wrong, but majority of them are a blast to play. If you have a few friends willing to throw 8 bucks at the game + all dlc when on sale, the experience is even more amplified on higher difficulties. Seeing those numbers get higher and higher, being able to go toe to toe with an ogre on nightmare and ruthless is an achievement in and of itself once you go through the leveling up experience. If you like God Tier rolls on equipment with different numbers and amplifiers, this game will get you hooked on picking up every single piece of loot you see.

I highly advise wish listing and waiting til the game goes on sale. 8 bucks for the game and all DLC is a steal considering the game has 100+ hours worth of content. In the end, I believe this is the greatest Tower Defense game of all time. I don't know what makes a great tower defense game cause this is the only TD game I'll ever play.

184847012.review:
Dark Souls 2: Better.

As much as Dungeon Defenders 1 succeeds in providing an entertaining experience, it pales in comparison to Dark Souls 2. Dark Souls 2 offers a far deeper, more immersive world, with a level of challenge and complexity that is unmatched. The combat in Dark Souls 2 requires not just reflexes, but patience, precision, and strategy, offering a far more rewarding experience. The intricate world-building, cryptic lore, and connection between the environments create a game that encourages exploration and mastery, with each victory feeling hard-earned. Dungeon Defenders 1, while fun and engaging in its own right, simply cannot match the emotional depth, difficulty, and transformative experience that Dark Souls 2 provides. When it comes to gaming experiences that challenge your skill and leave a lasting impact, Dark Souls 2 is the obvious choice.

184145453.review:
Dungeon Defenders is an absolute gem that combines the best elements of tower defense and action RPGs into a vibrant, chaotic, and endlessly fun experience. Whether you’re playing solo or teaming up with friends, this game offers a perfect blend of strategy, combat, and progression that keeps you hooked from the very first wave.

A Perfect Fusion of Tower Defense and RPG Action:

At its core, Dungeon Defenders is a tower defense game, but it adds an exciting twist by letting you jump into the action yourself. You’re not just placing towers and watching the chaos unfold—you’re right in the thick of it, slashing enemies, casting spells, and repairing your defenses as hordes of enemies swarm your dungeon. This hybrid gameplay makes every match engaging and keeps you constantly on your toes.

Diverse Heroes and Customization:

One of Dungeon Defenders’ greatest strengths is its cast of heroes. Each character class feels distinct, with unique abilities, playstyles, and defenses to deploy. Whether you prefer the Squire’s tanky melee combat, the Apprentice’s devastating magic towers, or the Huntress’s traps and ranged attacks, there’s a playstyle for everyone. Add in the loot system, where you’re constantly finding and upgrading gear, and the game delivers that addictive RPG progression that keeps you grinding for better loot.

Challenging Maps and Endless Replayability:

The maps in Dungeon Defenders are colorful, creative, and packed with variety. From tight corridors to sprawling arenas, each level feels distinct and offers its own challenges. The difficulty ramps up nicely, too, with harder modes and survival challenges that test your skills and strategy. No matter how many times you play, experimenting with new hero builds, tower placements, and team strategies keeps the game fresh.

A Co-Op Masterpiece:

Where Dungeon Defenders truly shines is in co-op play. Teaming up with friends to defend the crystal is an absolute blast, as you coordinate strategies, cover lanes, and combine abilities to take down waves of enemies. The synergy between different hero classes adds a layer of depth that’s incredibly satisfying, especially when you manage to overcome a tough wave with clever teamwork.

The Grind and the Glory:

Like any good RPG, Dungeon Defenders rewards dedication. Grinding for better loot and leveling up your heroes can be time-consuming, but it’s worth it when you finally equip that powerful weapon or max out your favorite character. The game also features additional modes and challenges that extend its lifespan, ensuring there’s always something to work toward.

Final Thoughts:

Dungeon Defenders is an addictive blend of strategy and action, with vibrant visuals, deep customization, and plenty of content to keep you coming back. Whether you’re a tower defense fan, an RPG lover, or just looking for a fun co-op game to play with friends, Dungeon Defenders delivers on all fronts.

Prepare your defenses, grab your best gear, and get ready to fend off wave after wave of enemies—it’s a chaotic ride you won’t want to miss.

Rating: 9/10

183923119.review:
地牢守护者，没中文，有卡。118个成就。有2个免费DLC。
2011年的多人塔防游戏。超11000条好评。2024年12月28日还在更新！
非免费，2024年12月冬促的价格是11.6RMB。

机翻简介：
《地下城捍卫者》是一款塔防动作rpg游戏，你必须从远古恶魔手中拯救Etheria的土地！从四个不同的职业中创建一个英雄，通过召唤防御和直接参与动作丰富的战斗来击退一波又一波的敌人！
自定义和升级你的角色，锻造装备，收集战利品，收集宠物和更多！带你的英雄通过多个难度模式和挑战/生存任务，以获得更多的经验和更好的宝藏。与您的朋友一起进行4人在线和本地（分屏）合作，共同规划您的战略或在PvP死亡竞赛中竞争。

关键特性
4人在线和本地合作-与最多3个朋友合作防御，角色职业相互支持对方的长处和弱点。动态结合本地（分屏）和在线玩家，随时离开/加入，这样游戏就总是满的。

选择你的职业，自定义你的角色和装备，战略性地组装你的防御，并直接参与行动丰富的战斗，以保护你的城堡免受入侵的部落！

4个不同的角色类别-每个角色类别都有不同的技能树，一套塔，甚至基本的攻击！你可以选择是否你想玩潜行，变成隐形，并与猎人在敌人后方设置陷阱，或全力以赴，阻挡咽喉点，并残酷地击败你的敌人与乡绅投降！

战利品和升级-抓住成堆的金钱和物品，你击败的敌人掉落和交易他们或存储他们为以后使用在你的物品箱！完成击杀和完成波可以让你获得经验值，这些经验值可以用来升级你的角色、技能、装备和塔。你想提高生命值，攻击率，伤害等吗？选择权在你……将大量多余的钱储存在“Mana Bank”中，然后用它来完善你的装备或与其他玩家进行交易。自豪地炫耀你最好的装备在你自己的“冒险家的酒馆”，不用担心物品被盗！

数以吨计的敌人和巨大的Boss战斗-超过100个同时发生的敌人将试图撕裂你的防御，巨大的Boss怪物将出现在每个人身上。只有采用最有效的防御策略，团队合作和坚强的性格，你才能打败这些恶魔！敌人种类繁多，从挥舞着巨大斧头的大笨兽人，到从阴影中出击的黑暗精灵，再到疯狂的神风特攻队地精！你能打败史诗般的boss战斗并收集特殊的战利品，同时仍然保护你的水晶吗？

任务和游戏玩法多样性-每个关卡都有不同的视觉设置，布局，敌人类型，陷阱和独特的惊喜。为了收集所有的战利品并达到最高等级，你必须让你的角色通过4个难度模式，生存任务，挑战地图等等！有些地图迫使你有移动防御，保护一个水晶在地图上扭曲。另一些则让你攻击敌人的营地！

在线收集和交易宠物-在Etheria的土地上有各种各样的宠物来帮助你，每一个都有不同的行为。这些宠物可以升级和定制，以配合您独特的游戏风格。他们甚至可以与其他玩家在线交易！

安全交易系统-害怕另一个玩家不会遵守他们的诺言？使用我们的安全交易系统与其他玩家在线交易您的珍贵武器，盔甲和宠物！看着你的名字和名声在网上传播，因为人们寻找最好的宠物饲养者或物品伪造者！
堆积如山的数据——你的每一枪，你的每一击，你的每一击，你的每一击，你的每一道防线，都会被记录下来，留给后代。在每个回合结束时仔细研究大量的图表和图形，分析你的团队的表现，快速回顾你在每个关卡的最佳统计数据，并将你的数据与其他玩家在线比较，看看谁是最伟大的英雄。此外，你的成就对所有人都是可见的，在你自己的冒险家酒馆里，你的每个英雄的最高分数都在全球排行榜上排名！
地下城捍卫者开发工具包-地下城捍卫者包括一个免费的开发工具包，您可以在其中创建和编辑新的地下城捍卫者任务，并利用所有现有的地下城捍卫者资产。通过Steam工作室下载并分享这些用户创建的关卡，以获得无尽的地下城捍卫者体验！
